results.title: The Pied piper of Hamelin: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Cosgrove-Hall Productions, Mark Hall and Brian Cosgrove
results.brief_description: This tape includes two wonderful fairy tales featuring puppets from Cosgrove Hall studios. “The Pied piper of Hamelin”; set in the fourteenth century this story centres around the greedy councillors who reneg on a promise to pay the piper for ridding the township of rats. They pay dearly for their broken promise. Narrated by Robert Hardy with music composed by David Rohl and Stuart J. Wolstenholme. The presentation of “Cinderella” is based on the one by Perrault, with the unusual feature of being told through the music which was specially composed for the film. A spectacular blend of puppetry, animation, music and colour. Music is once again composed by David Rohl and Stuart J Wolstenholme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cosgrove-Hall Productions, Mark Hall and Brian Cosgrove

results.title: The Pied piper of Hamelin (K)
results.creator_credit: Cosgrove-Hall Productions, Brian Cosgrove and Mark Hall
results.brief_description: An animated puppet film for children, based on the poem by Robert Browning about the events in the town of Hamelin after a plague of rats invade the town. Narrated by Robert Hardy. Puppets by Bridget Appleby.

results.title: The Picture woman
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Oracle Pictures, Robert Reynolds, Victor Gentile and Peter Rasmussen
results.brief_description: A woman whose life has been photographed every day since birth looks back at her life and asks, “can a lifetime be embraced in one breath?”. (Awards: London Film Festival, 1998; Mill Valley Film Festival, 1998; Montreal Film Festival, 1998)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Film Commission, Oracle Pictures, Robert Reynolds, Victor Gentile and Peter Rasmussen

results.title: The Picture gallery
results.brief_description: Intrinsic in many great paintings is a sense of movement. Rather than seeming static, the figures appear to be caught in motion. A young Czech animator, Jan Trmal, has taken ten such paintings and by separating their elements has actually set them in motion for a brief time to the music of Gianfranco Maselli, Antonin Vranicky and Johann S. Bach.

results.title: The Picnic
results.brief_description: A small boy kept in after school finds a notice about a girls’ picnic and shows it to the boys who plan to gate crash. The girls realise this and prepare sandwiches with shoe nugget and drinks with paint. When the boys raid the lunch bags they receive a nasty shock.

results.title: The Pianist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Roman Polanski, Robert Benmussa and Alain Sarde
results.brief_description: An epic but true tale of the pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman’s struggle as a Polish Jew to survive World War II. Based on a book by Szpilman, Ronald Harwood’s Academy Award winning screenplay covers the period of the second World War. Roman Polanski’s skill in motion picture storytelling is evident here as he is also a winner of the Academy Award for Best Director. The film received seven nominations in all, most notably the Best Actor Award going to Adrien Brody for his portrayal of Szpilman. A gifted composer and pianist, Szpilman was making regular appearances on Polish radio when the Nazis overran Warsaw. His family are taken to the walled Ghetto where Szpilman is able to make a meagre living by playing piano in a cafe where the more affluent and sometimes corrupt Jewish people dine. He narrowly escapes the fate of his family’s trip to the death camps and survives with the help of friends and his own instinct and just pure willpower. A sympathetic German officer who is moved by his talent also spares and sustains his life. A moving portrayal of the plight of Polish Jews but one which also shows that there are good and bad people on every side during times of war. Special edition two-disc set including a thirty-minute documentary on the making of the film. Other Awards include the Palme D’Or at Cannes 2002. Cast includes Thomas Kretschmann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Studio Canal, Roman Polanski, Robert Benmussa and Alain Sarde
